metadata.title: CVE-2023-6931 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - high
metadata.description:
A heap out-of-bounds write vulnerability in the Linux kernel's PerformanceEvents system component can be exploited to achieve local privilegeescalation. A perf_event's read_size can overflow, leading to an heapout-of-bounds increment or write in perf_read_group(). We recommendupgrading past commit 382c27f4ed28f803b1f1473ac2d8db0afc795a1b.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-6931` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-92-generic - 5.15.0-92.102
linux-image-5.15.0-92-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-92.102
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-92-generic - 5.15.0-92.102
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-92-generic-64k - 5.15.0-92.102
No subscription required

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-92.102').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'superseded by linux-hwe-6.2').
